Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API Main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks if the database connection is working. It does this by making a request to the database and checking if it returns any results. If there are no results, then we know something went wrong with our connection.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Get the database session object

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.index(request: Request)¶

The index function is executed when someone visits the root URL of our site. It returns a TemplateResponse object, which tells Starlette to render the index.html template from our templates directory.

Parameters:

request – Request: Get the request object

Returns:

A templateresponse object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are used by the app, such as databases or caches.

Returns:

A list of coroutines

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.user_agent_ban_middleware(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The user_agent_ban_middleware function is a middleware function that checks the user-agent header of an incoming request. If the user-agent matches any of the patterns in USER_AGENT_BAN_LIST, then it returns a 403 Forbidden response. Otherwise, it calls call_next and returns its result.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the request object

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the request to the next middleware in line

Returns:

A jsonresponse object if the user-agent string matches one of the banned patterns

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_todo(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The create_todo function creates a new todo item.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Get the user who is making the request

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_all_contacts function returns a list of all contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first n rows of data

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contact function returns a contact object from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Filter the query by contact id

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first n records

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass a database connection to the function

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify which contact to remove

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Identify the user who is making the request

Returns:

A contact object if the contact was found and deleted, or none if it wasn’t

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact that we want to update

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass a database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user from the request

Returns:

A contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function marks a user as confirmed in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to be confirmed

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserSchema object as input and returns the newly created user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_user_by_email function returns a user object from the database based on the email address provided.

If no user is found, None is returned.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of the parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A single user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Args:

email (str): The email address of the user to update. url (str): The URL for the new avatar image. db (AsyncSession): An async database session object, used to commit changes and query data from a database. This is an example of dependency injection, which allows us to mock out this function in our tests without having access to an actual database connection.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of the url parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session object

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Specify that the token parameter can either be a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address. It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, we return an HTTP 400 error with a detail message of “Verification error”. If they do exist in our database but their confirmed field is already True (meaning their email has already been confirmed), then we return a JSON response with a message saying “Your email is already confirmed”. Otherwise, we call repositories.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the URL.

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function.

Returns:

A dict with a message.

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user. It takes the username and password from the request body, and returns an access token if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh the access token using a valid refresh token.

This function checks if the refresh token is valid and returns a new access token. If the refresh token is invalid, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized).

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the refresh token from the request header.

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function.

Returns:

A JSON object containing the access_token, refresh_token, and token_type.

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(username: str, response: Response, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is called when a user opens an email. It saves the fact that the user opened an email in the database, and returns a 1x2 pixel image to be displayed in their browser.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username from the url

  • response – Response: Get the response object of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

An image

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It also sends an email to the user with a link to verify their account. The function returns the newly created User object.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the body of the request

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add the send_email function to a background task

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object, but we want to return a token

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes CONTACTs¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database. The function takes in a ContactSchema object, which is validated by pydantic. If the validation fails, an error will be thrown and caught by FastAPI’s exception handler. If it passes validation, then we create a new contact using our repository_contacts module.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body.

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer.

  • user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in.

Returns:

A ContactResponse object.

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database. The function takes in an integer representing the id of the contact to be deleted, and returns a dictionary containing information about that contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the URL path.

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer.

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service.

Returns:

A ContactResponse object.

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_all_todos(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_all_todos function returns a list of all todos in the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned.

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the limit parameter.

  • le – Limit the number of results returned.

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before returning results.

  • ge – Specify a minimum value.

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database.

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function returns a contact by its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: A contact object :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user. The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned.

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of a parameter.

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned.

  • offset – int: Get the next set of data from the database.

  • ge – Specify the minimum value that can be passed in.

  • le – Limit the number of contacts that can be returned.

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function.

  • user – User: Get the user from the database.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdateSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

REST API routes USERs¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is used to get the current user from the database.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request.

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database.

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database.

Returns:

The user object.

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service AUTH¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded in the jwt token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

An encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in the class. The iat (issued at) claim is set to datetime.utcnow() and exp (expiration time) is set to one day from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass a dictionary to the function

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): The data to be encoded in the JWT. This should include at least a username and an email address, but can also include other information such as roles or permissions. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until this token expires, defaults to 7 days if not specified.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user data to be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the refresh token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

The function will raise an HTTPException if the token is invalid or has expired. If the token is valid, it will return a string with the email address of user who owns that refresh_token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the UserRouter class. It takes an access token as input and returns the user object associated with it.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

  • db – Session: Get the database session from the dependency

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶
The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token.

If the token is invalid, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶
The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password.

The function uses the pwd_context object to generate a hash from the given password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass the password to be hashed into the function

Returns:

A string of the hashed password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶
The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and the hashed version of that password,

and returns True if they match, False otherwise. This is used to verify that the user’s login credentials are correct.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Check if the password entered by the user is correct

  • hashed_password – Check if the password is hashed

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their email address.
The function takes in three arguments:

-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a unique identifier for them. -username: the username of the user, which is displayed in the body of the message. -host: this is used to construct a URL that will be sent in an HTML template.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Pass the email address to send the message to

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to which we want to redirect our user after he/she has confirmed his/her email

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
